segments.text: I see the boy on the stool reaching for the cookie jar, and I’m worried he’s going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool looks so unstable, and the girl is just standing there waiting.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman at the sink is completely unaware of what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I need to step in and help before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water overflowing is bad enough, but the kids are adding to the chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe the woman hasn’t noticed the puddle at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, and the stool is about to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching a disaster unfold in slow motion.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope the boy doesn’t fall, but I’m not sure he’ll be able to keep his balance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This whole scene is making me so nervous.
segments.speaker: PAR
